snippet: Researchers have found genetic evidence that temperature-driven changes in migration and reproduction behaviors may be evidence of natural selection at work.
abstract: Ryan P Kovach study in the Proceedings of the Royal Society B reports genetic evidence that some Alaskan salmon have evolved to migrate earlier, adapting to global warming and shifting stream temperatures.
lead_paragraph: Researchers have found genetic evidence that temperature-driven changes in migration and reproduction behaviors may be evidence of natural selection at work.

headline.print_headline: Alaskan Salmon Evolve Along With the Climate
headline.main: Alaskan Salmon Evolve Along With the Climate

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Proceedings of the Royal Society B
